p: As the cellular receptor for SARS-CoV-2, angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is the key for SARS-CoV to enter target cells during the course of viral infection [ 23–25]. Expression of ACE2 protein in human organs showed that ACE2 is most abundantly expressed on the surface of alveolar epithelial cells and small intestine epithelial cells [ 26], which are involved in the progression of pneumonia [ 27]. Intriguingly, a connection may exist between the lungs and GI tract [ 28], and SARS-CoV-2 may be shed through multiple routes in the different phases of viral infection.
